contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox scientist |name = Józef Kostrzewski |image = |birth_date = {{Birth date|1885|2|25}} |birth_place = [[Węglewo, Poznań County|Węglewo]] |death_date = {{Death date and age|1969|10|19|1885|2|25}} |death_place = [[Poznań]] |nationality = [[Poland|Polish]] |ethnicity = |field = [[archaeology|Archaeologist]] |work_institutions = |alma_mater = |doctoral_advisor = |doctoral_students = |known_for = |influences = |influenced = |prizes = |religion = }} '''Józef Kostrzewski''' (February 25, 1885 – October 19, 1969) was a [[Poland|Polish]] [[archaeology|archaeologist]]. Kostrzewski was born in [[Węglewo, Poznań County|Węglewo]] (now in [[Poznań County]]). He studied first in [[Kraków]], then from 1910 onwards with [[Gustaf Kossinna]] at [[Berlin]] and graduated in 1914. Back in Poland, he was to turn Kossinna's settlement-archaeological method ("[[siedlungsarchäologische Methode]]") against its creator and to try to prove a [[Slavic peoples|Slavonic]] [[Slavic peoples#Autochthonic|autochthonism]] in Poland from at least the [[Bronze Age]] ([[Lusatian culture]]) onwards. Kostrzewski became professor of prehistory at the newly founded [[University of Poznań]] in 1919, and from 1934 conducted the excavation of the [[Iron Age]] settlement of [[Biskupin]], which he continued after the war. After 1918, Kostrzewski became involved in bitter polemics about the ethnic ascription of the [[Lusatian culture|Lusatian]] and [[Pomeranian culture]]s with the German archaeologist [[Bolko von Richthofen]]. During the German occupation of Poland during [[World War II]], Polish universities and museums were closed, the finds were often transported to Germany, and many scholars were arrested, tortured and detained, or murdered.{{Citation needed|date=May 2013}} Kostrzewski hid from the [[Gestapo]] during the war, but returned to his Poznań chair in 1945. He died in Poznań. ==Publications== * Gród prasłowiański w Biskupine w powiecie żnińskim (Poznań 1938). * Kultura prapolska (1947) * with W. Chmielelewski and [[Konrad Jażdżewski|K. Jażdżewski]], Pradzieje Polski (Wrocław 1965) ==Further reading== *J. Lech, Between captivity and freedom: Polish archaeology in the 20th century.
